sentences.english: Particularly he play with arts, and don't pursuit fame and secular.
sentences.chinese: 特別是他“玩兒”藝術，不求功名，不問市儈。

sentences.english: Time curbed the artist's pride and the philistine's vulgarity .
sentences.chinese: 時間限制了藝術家的驕傲和市儈的鄙俗。

sentences.english: It is not just the Babbitts who think there's something odd about people who read poetry.
sentences.chinese: 不僅是市儈之流認爲讀詩的人有點古怪。

definition: lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
devotion to righteousness that inspires reverence (idiom)
to show every possible consideration (idiom); meticulous care
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
to have no sense of shame/brazen
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
scholars tend to disparage one another (idiom)
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
to wish for the whole world to be in chaos (idiom)
pinyin: wei2 kong3 tian1 xia4 bu4 luan4

definition: to step down gracefully (humble expression)/to concede defeat/to play second fiddle
